page.title: 05The River Avon Stratford
page.content: The River Avon meanders from east to west.It is a centre for Recreation and leisure activities.Coarse fishing is very popular and many anglers line the banks.Barges,motor boats,launches,as well as canoes,punts,and rowing boats pass back and forth full of tourists and holidaymakers.There is an annual Raft Race.In 1985 the race was from Wasperton to Stratford.There were over 40 rafts with most of the competitors entering for fun with the aim of just finishing the course.Many fell off when they went over the weir!There is also an annual Regatta over a 750m course between Stratford Mill and the Boat Club.In 1985 Stratford were one of the 45 clubs taking part.Altogether 159 crews entered and the Stratford crew won the final by a length.There are very few swans left on the river and much debate as to why this is so.
